definitions: To diminish or destroy the value or quality of.
To harm the character of (a child) by being too lenient or permissive.
To treat with great generosity and indulgence.
To become bad or unfit for use, especially food.
examples: Don't spoil your appetite with snacks.
The parents spoiled their only child.
She likes to spoil herself with a spa day.
The milk will spoil if left out too long.
